mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.blocks

Interface IScriptBlockState


  • public interface IScriptBlockState
    Scripted block state.

    This interface represents a block state that can be used to compare or place into the world. You can use IScriptFactory.createBlockState(String, int) to query for comparison.

    
    var andesite = mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:stone", 5);

    function main(c)
    {
        if (c.getWorld().getBlock(214, 3, 511).isSame(andesite))
        {
            c.getSubject().send("Block at (214, 3, 511) is indeed andesite!");
        }
    }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getBlockId()
      Get block's ID like minecraft:stone.
      int getMeta()
      Get meta value of this state (it will always be between 0 and 15).
      IBlockState getMinecraftBlockState()
      Get Minecraft block state instance.
      boolean hasCollision(IScriptWorld world, int x, int y, int z)
      Check whether given block state has collision boxes.
      boolean isAir()
      Check whether given block state is air.
      boolean isOpaque()
      Check whether given block state is occupying a full block entirely, rather than being see through or not full (1, 1, 1) block space.
      boolean isSame(IScriptBlockState state)
      Check whether this block state is same as given block state.
      boolean isSameBlock(IScriptBlockState state)
      Check whether given block state has the same block, but not necessarily the same meta value.

    • Method Detail

      • getMinecraftBlockState

        IBlockState getMinecraftBlockState()
        Get Minecraft block state instance. BEWARE: you need to know the MCP mappings in order to directly call methods on this instance!

      • getBlockId

        java.lang.String getBlockId()
        Get block's ID like minecraft:stone. 
        
    var block = c.getWorld().getBlock(214, 3, 511);

    c.getSubject().send("Block at (214, 3, 511) is " + block.getBlockId());

      • getMeta

        int getMeta()
        Get meta value of this state (it will always be between 0 and 15). 
        
    var andesite = mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:stone", 5);

    // This will print "Andesite's meta is 5"
    c.getSubject().send("Andesite's meta is " + andesite.getMeta());

      • isSame

        boolean isSame(IScriptBlockState state)
        Check whether this block state is same as given block state. 
        
    var andesite = mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:stone", 5);

    if (c.getWorld().getBlock(214, 3, 511).isSame(andesite))
    {
        c.getSubject().send("Block at (214, 3, 511) is indeed andesite!");
    }

      • isSameBlock

        boolean isSameBlock(IScriptBlockState state)
        Check whether given block state has the same block, but not necessarily the same meta value. 
        
    var andesite = mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:stone", 5);
    var stone = mappet.createBlockState("minecraft:stone", 0);

    // This will print true
    c.getSubject().send(stone.isSameBlock(andesite));

      • isOpaque

        boolean isOpaque()
        Check whether given block state is occupying a full block entirely, rather than being see through or not full (1, 1, 1) block space.

      • hasCollision

        boolean hasCollision(IScriptWorld world,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int z)
        Check whether given block state has collision boxes. Minecraft's block state code requires a world instance and block coordinates to be passed, because collision box can be different depending on the place in the world.

      • isAir

        boolean isAir()
        Check whether given block state is air.
